titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henry Baker, Letterbook
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:58
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract:
Anonymous MS.
Collection of copies of 210 letters to and from Baker dating from 1722 to 1770; letters discuss scientific subjects, especially microscopy, electricity, and the education of deaf children; also discuss contemporary affairs, most notably the Jacobite Rebellion (1745-1746) and the London earthquake (1750).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn fc109 1/2 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Henry Baker, Letterbook. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a complete inventory of the contents of Osborn fc109 1/2. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

controlaccess.subject: Electricity
English literature -- 18th century
English poetry -- 18th century
Jacobite Rebellion, 1745-1746
Letters
Microscopy
controlaccess.geogname: Great Britain -- Social life and customs -- 18th century

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1743 Dec - 1752 Aug
Norwich
23 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss a visit by John
Theophilus Desaguliers (1683-1744).
109/I/26,42,43,46,80 and
109/II/128,130,134,145

did.unittitle: "A Short Description of the Remains of Sr John Falstafs House in Norfolk": anonymous MS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Memorandum concerning Sir John
Falstaf (1378?-1459).
109/II/146

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Twickenham
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Requests names of members of the
Royal Society of London and
distinguishes varieties of
polyanthus.
109/I/60

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Biographical information on Dr.
Nathaniel Matthew Wolfe, physician
to Prince Fryderyk Michal Czartoryski
(1696-1775).
109/II/172

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
1 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Election and subsequent malfeasance
of Emanuel Mendes da Costa
(1717-1791); sale of his collections;
carelessness of James West
(1704?-1772).
109/II/175

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[London]
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Attempts to recover his letters to
the late William Arderon (1703-1767)
and John Browning.
109/II/189

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1744 Nov - 1752 Jul
London
31 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss: Baker's work; the
Royal Society of London; John Hill
(1716?-1778); James Harrison
(1693-1776); and microscopes
developed by Mr. Page and Lindsay;
also mentions John Montagu (2nd duke
of Montagu, 1690-1749).
109/I/32,42,43,46,56,63,76,82,103
and 109/II/124,135,139,141

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1746 Nov - 1749 Feb
London
16 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss extrasensory
perception; mention David Erskine,
9th earl of Buchan (1672-1745),
Alexander Hume Campbell (1708-1760),
and George MacKenzie, 1st earl of
Cromarty (1630-1714).
109/I/59,64,72,101 and 109/II/114

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
5 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Concerns the death of her husband,
Robert Blair (1699-1746).
109/I/55

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1743 Jun - 1746,
London
18 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss: Baker's winning the
Copley Medal and his "History of the
Polype"; George Adams; George
Berkeley, bp. of Cloyne (1685-1753);
Martin Folkes (1690-1754); Thomas
Thompson (d.1763); and the death of
Alexander Pope (1688-1744).
109/I/16,20,23,28,30,33,39,49

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[London]
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letter discusses the speech
production of a young girl with no
tongue.
109/I/12

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
3 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
On the death of Dr. Cromwell Mortimer
(d.1752); Thomas Birch (1705-1766)
elected as successor; also discusses
proposals by Emanuel Mendes da Costa
(1717-1791) for a book on fossils.
109/II/140

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1746 Dec - [1758] Jul
London
18 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss: the Royal Society
of London; experiments with
electricity carried out by Sir
William Watson (1715-1787); theories
of John Hill (1716?-1778); the
classifications of Linneus (Carl von
Linne, 1707-1778); Peter Camper
(1722-1789); William Stukeley
(1687-1765); the death of John
Montagu (2nd duke of Montagu,
1690-1749); Richard Wilkes
(1691-1760); Robert Clayton (Bp. of
Clogher, 1695-1758).
109/I/61,87 and
109/II/116,117,164,165

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[1743] Dec - 1747 Aug
London
14 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss: Abraham Trembley
(1700-1784); George Anson, baron
Anson (1697-1762); various electrical
experiments; and the Jacobite
Rebellion of 1745-1746.
109/I/24,31,44,47,54,78

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1743 Sep and 1748 Sep
London
3 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss a scientific
monograph by Dr. Gianfrancesco Pivati
(1689-1764) which was translated by
David Erskine Baker (1730-1767); also
discusses experiments with
microscopes.
109/II/106

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Strand
3 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Baker will deliver paintings to
Charles Lyttelton, bp. of Carlisle
(1714-1768); collections of Emanuel
Mendes da Costa (1717-1791) will be
sold ro the relief of bondsmen;
turbulence of supporters of John
Wilkes (1727-1797).
109/II/193

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Thanks Demours for his translation
of Baker's "History of the Polype".
109/I/40

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1747 Nov - 1751 Jan
London
32 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss: the education of
deaf mutes; the development of
Philosophical Societies; the London
earthquake (1750); the method of
innoculation proposed by John Ranby
(1703-1773); also mentions the
Christmas party given by John
Montagu, 2nd duke of Montagu
(1690-1749).
109/I/ 89,92,95,104 and
109/II/112,125,131,136

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1741 Feb and 1750 Mar
London
4 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Comments on Benjamin Boddington and
on the London earthquake of 1750.
109/I/11 and 109/II/126

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
1 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Baker will try to locate the son of
Dr. Cromwell Mortimer (ca.1700-1752)
who is in possession of a MS which
Gough is seeking.
109/II/202

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
3 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Discusses Hall's philosophical
writings; mentions frequent
appearances of a comet.
109/II/119

did.unittitle: Letter (copy) to [Charles Lyttelton, bp. of Carlisle (1714-1768)]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Strand
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Discusses supposed remains of the
London residence of Thomas Wolsey,
cardinal Wolsey (1475?-1530).
109/II/191

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1743 Nov - 1751 Jan
London
30 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss electrical
experiments, John Hill (1716?-1775),
Robert Boyle (1627-1691), Francis
Hawksbee (1687-1763), Sir William
Watson (1715-1787), Edmund Halley
1656-1742), John Tuberville Needham
(1713-1781), Gianfrancesco Pivati
(1689-1764), and Miles's own proposed
work on the "History of Electricity";
also included are drawings by David
Erskine Baker (1730-1767).
109/I/22,38,41,50,52,58,85,105
and 109/I/115,122,137,138

did.unittitle: Letter (copy) to George Brudenell Montagu, earl of Cardigan (later 3rd duke of Montagu, 1712-1790)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[London]
3 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
The recipient's father, John Montagu,
2nd duke of Montagu (1690-1749), had
admired Baker's "Employment for the
Microscope" (1753); sends a copy to
the son who also is interested in the
subject.
109/II/144

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1748 May - 1770 Feb
London
22 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss the Royal Society of
London and the Royal Society of Arts,
mistaken treatment of the American
colonies, and poverty and luxury in
contemporary London; also mentions
the electric shock of Robert Clayton,
bp. of Clogher (1695-1768), the death
of Henry Baker, Jr. (1734-1766), and
the education of William Baker
(1763-1828).
109/I/99 and 109/II/182,188,196,206

did.unittitle: 2 letters (copies) to Pitt Ridgeway, 7th earl of Londonderry (1719?-1765)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1747 Sep and 1747 Oct
London
4 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss scientific projects
and the spread of a cattle disease.
109/I/79, 81

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Catharine Street
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Recommends lightning conductor
invented by Benjamin Franklin
(1706-1790).
109/II/143

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Baker has received the description
of Symonds's coin collection and
will aid the recipient in his search
for duplicates or needed specimens.
109/II/120

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
5 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Discusses the recent earthquakes
(London earthquake and its
aftershocks); also includes a list
of coins for exchange or acquired by
Thomas Lawrence (1711-1783).
109/II/127

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1753 Nov - 1770 Nov
London
31 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss political affairs in
England: trouble with the American
colonies and India; food prices;
Jewish enfranchisement; the ministry
of Augustus Henry Fitzroy, 3rd duke
of Grafton (1735-1811); allegations
of corruption by Samuel Musgrave
(1732-1780); attempts to clean and
illuminate London; affairs of Thomas
Birch (1705-1766) and John Wilkes
(1727-1797).
109/II/152,180,186,198,205,207,209

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1739 Feb - 1745 Mar
London
7 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss speech production;
mention John Copping (b.1698),
William Holder (1616-1698), Vincent
Browne (1695-1747), John Kippax
(1682-1760), and Richard Pocock, bp.
of Meath (1704-1765).
109/I/6,14,37

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1766 Mar - 1769 Aug
London
19 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss Bernard Jussieu
(1698-1777), James Short (1710-1768),
John Smeaton (1724-1792), and Joseph
Planta (1724-1827).
109/II/183,185,194,201

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Kinnoul
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Answers to the queries propounded by
Henry Baker (1698-1774).
109/I/74

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1746 Dec - 1749 Aug
Gardald
35 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss instances of second
sight and extrasensory perception.
109/I/62,65,69,73,97,108
and 109/II/118

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Athelstaneford
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Death of her husband, Robert Blair
(1699-1746);
see Osborn Shelves fc 109/I/55.
109/I/53

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1743 Jun - 1745 Feb
Athelstaneford
13 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss Baker's and Blair's
works and microscopes; a poem
entitled "Sacharissa Weeping" is
also included.
109/I/15,17,21,27,29,35

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Ipswich
1 p.; 32 x 21 cn.
Letter discusses the case of a girl
whose cancerous tongue falls out.
109/I/10

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1753 Oct - 1755 Mar
6 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss scientific projects,
the financial difficulties of Emanuel
Mendes da Costa (1717-1791), and the
proposed membership in the Royal
Society of London of Thomas Pennant
(1726-1798); also mentions Charles
Lyttelton, bp. of Carlisle
(1714-1768).
109/II/150,156,157

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Maryland
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Sends condolences on the loss of
Baker's wife, Sophia (Defoe) Baker
(1705?-1762); discusses dyes and
samples of dyed cotton which he will
send.
109/II/167

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1748 Apr 9 and 1749 Oct
Burton Hill [Yorks.]
9 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss cremation and urn
burial, a description of Stonehenge
by John Wood (1705?-1754), and
information on zinc smelting.
109/I/98 and 109/II/123

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
1 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letter discusses his son's progress
and sends compliments to Mary
(Hutton) Worstenholme, lady
Worstenholme, and John Forster.
109/I/4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[1748 Feb] and 1748 Sep
n.p.
3 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss electrical
experiments; also mention
Gianfrancesco Pivati (1698-1764) and
Sir William Watson (1715-1787).
109/I/94, 107

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Clogher
1 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters sends thanks for a previous
letter from Baker and informs Baker
that the enclosure he sent to
Clayton has been sent to Thomas
Walls (b.1672).
109/I/71

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Mill Hill
1 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
About a packet for Charles Lyttelton,
bp. of Carlisle (1714-1768).
109/II/192

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1722 and 1723 [no dates]
Hammersmith
4 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Attempts to show Baker's poems to
Alexander Pope (1688-1744) and
Thomas Tickell (1686-1740).
109/I/1,2,3

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
3 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Seeks an appointment to the Royal
Society of London; mentions Francis
Hawksbee (1687-1763).
109/II/174,176

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Humby
12 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Answers Baker's 8 questions about
second sight with 10 reported
examples of it.
109/I/70

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1747 Nov - 1750 Oct
n.p.
67 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss the London earthquake
(1750), the Philosophical Society and
the report to it by William Shipley
(1714-1803), as well as the Jekyll
Fund (Sir Joseph Jekyll, 1663-1738);
included is a monograph on Locusts.
109/I/86,90,93,100,102,109
and 109/II/113,129,132,133

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Barton
1 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Thanks him for his poem of "the
Universe".
109/II/110

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1753 Dec - 1757 Apr
Charlestown, S.C.
24 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss various scientific,
mostly botanical and zoological,
projects: mentions many important
scientific figures, among others:
John Ellis (1710-1776); William
Arderon (1702-1767); John Huxham
(1692-1768); Cadwallader Colden
(1688-1777); John Bartram (1699-
1777); Benjamin Franklin (1706-1790);
John Clayton (1693-1773); Mark
Catesby (1679-1749); Pehr Kalm (1716-
1779); Carl von Linne (1707-1778);
William Shipley (1714-1803); and
Charles Plumier (1646-1704).
109/II/158,160,163

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Charlestown, S.C.
7 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
List of crops and commodities;
discusses threshing machines in
comparison to slave labor.
109/II/159

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Canterbury
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Sends his account of a "fireball"
[meteor] which was seen two years
earlier in Deal.
109/II/111

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1769 Aug and 1770 Mar
n.p.
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss a work by Maurice
Johnson (1688-1755) and a proposed
"Memoirs of the Society of
Antiquaries"; a biography of Henry
Hare, 3rd baron Coleraine (1693-1749)
is also included.
109/II/200,208

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Alnwick. 2 p.; 32 x 21 cm. Discusses two sycamore trees growing around stones fallen from a nearby wall. 109/II/203

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: St. Petersburg 5 p.; 32 x 21 cm. Letter discusses the "Everlasting Fire" seen near Baku, as well as other natural phenomena. 109/I/57

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
2 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Sends her thanks for his past help and
kindness with regard to her education.
109/II/210

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1743 Sep - 1756 Dec
Tooting
23 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss scientific
experiments, as well as Jean Nicolas
Sebastien Allamand (1713-1787), John
Ellis (1710-1776), and Sir Hans
Sloane, bart. (1660-1753); also
mentions the Jacobite Rebellion of
1745-1746.
109/I/19,34,36,48,51,88 and
109/II/121,162,153-155

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[London]
3 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letter discusses the articulation of
tongueless speakers.
109/I/13

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[1747] - 1762 Nov, n.p.
21 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss Mounsey's positions
as an army physician and court
physician in Russia; also discusses
a treatment for rabies, an earthquake
in Siberia, and introduces the
rhubarb.
109/I/77,84,96 and 109/II/166,168

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1753 Oct and 1756 Jan
Downing
3 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss scientific matters.
109/II/151,161

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Northampton
5 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Discusses his recent visits to sights
of "British Antiquity", in particular
Stonehenge, Wansdyke, and Avebury;
describes the interaction of the
local residents with the monuments,
paying special attention in this
regard to Avebury; also mentions Dr.
Stephen Hales (1677-1761).
109/II/149

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Gt. Russell St., Bloomsbury
1 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letter discusses a poem on the
universe which he will hand to the
Royal Society of London.
109/I/9

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1739 Jan - 1739 Aug
Dublin
7 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters discuss Walls' opinions on
speech production and his methods and
fees for teaching the deaf.
109/I/5,7,8

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1762 Dec - 1769 Nov
n.p.
54 p.; 32 x 21 cm.
Letters describe a tour of Poland
with Prince Fryderyk Michal
Czartoryski (1696-1777); mentions
the death of Augustus III, king of
Poland (1696-1763); also makes
medical observations, commenting on
smallpox vaccinations and rabies.
109/II/173,177-179,181,184.187,190,
195,197,199,204
